com.netflix.genie.web.services.impl

Class JobKillServiceV3

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.netflix.genie.web.services.impl.JobKillServiceV3

  • public class JobKillServiceV3
extends java.lang.Object
    A JobKillService that attempts to kill genie 3.0 jobs running on the local node.
    Since:
    3.0.0

      Constructor.

      Kill the job with the given id if possible.
      void onKillJobEvent(@NotNull KillJobEvent event)
      Listen for job kill events from within the system as opposed to on calls from users directly to killJob.

                        boolean runAsUser,
                        @NotNull
                        @NotNull GenieEventBus genieEventBus,

                        @NotNull
                        @NotNull com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper objectMapper,
                        @NotNull
                        ProcessChecker.Factory processCheckerFactory)
        Constructor.
        Parameters:
        hostname - The name of the host this Genie node is running on
        jobSearchService - The job search service to use to locate job information
        executor - The executor to use to run system processes
        runAsUser - True if jobs are run as the user who submitted the job
        genieEventBus - The system event bus to use
        genieWorkingDir - The working directory where all job directories are created.
        objectMapper - The Jackson ObjectMapper used to serialize from/to JSON
        processCheckerFactory - The process checker factory

    • Method Detail

      • killJob

        public void killJob(@NotBlank(message="No id entered. Unable to kill job.")
                    @NotBlank(message="No id entered. Unable to kill job.") java.lang.String id,
                    @NotBlank(message="No reason provided.")
                    @NotBlank(message="No reason provided.") java.lang.String reason)
             throws GenieException
        Kill the job with the given id if possible. Should publish a JobFinishedEvent when done.
        Parameters:
        id - id of job to kill
        reason - brief reason for requesting the job be killed
        Throws:
        GenieException - if there is an error

      • onKillJobEvent

        @EventListener
public void onKillJobEvent(@NotNull
                                          @NotNull KillJobEvent event)
                                   throws GenieException
        Listen for job kill events from within the system as opposed to on calls from users directly to killJob.
        Parameters:
        event - The KillJobEvent
        Throws:
        GenieException - On error
